title: Manali
description: Solang Valley, Rohtang Pass, Hidimba Devi Temple, and Manu Temple are prominent attractions in and around Manali, Himachal Pradesh. Solang Valley is a stunning destination known for adventure sports like paragliding, skiing, and snowboarding. Rohtang Pass, located at an altitude of over 13,000 feet, offers breathtaking views of the Himalayas and is a gateway to Lahaul-Spiti. Hidimba Devi Temple, nestled among cedar forests, is a unique wooden temple dedicated to Hidimba, a character from the Mahabharata. Manu Temple, dedicated to sage Manu, the creator of mankind, is a peaceful spiritual site located in the old part of Manali.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and local sightseeing
Day 2: Solang Valley and Rohtang Pass
Day 3: Visit Hidimba Devi Temple and Manu Temple
Day 4: Adventure activities like river rafting
Day 5: Shopping and departure

title: Goa
description: Calangute Beach, Baga Beach, Basilica of Bom Jesus, and Dudhsagar Falls are some of the most popular tourist attractions in Goa. Calangute Beach, often called the “Queen of Beaches,” is known for its lively atmosphere, water sports, and vibrant nightlife. Nearby, Baga Beach is famous for its beach parties, shacks, and adventure activities like jet skiing and parasailing. Basilica of Bom Jesus, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, houses the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier and showcases stunning baroque architecture. Dudhsagar Falls, located on the Goa-Karnataka border, is a majestic four-tiered waterfall surrounded by lush greenery and trekking trails.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and North Goa beaches
Day 2: South Goa churches and beaches
Day 3: Water sports and spice plantation
Day 4: Departure

title: Jaipur
description:
City Palace – A magnificent royal residence combining Rajasthani and Mughal architecture, the City Palace is a sprawling complex with courtyards, gardens, and museums showcasing Jaipur’s royal heritage.
	Amber Fort – Located on a hilltop, Amber Fort is a stunning blend of Hindu and Mughal styles, known for its ornate palaces, mirror work, and panoramic views of the surrounding Aravalli hills.
	Hawa Mahal – Also called the “Palace of Winds,” this pink sandstone facade has hundreds of small windows designed for royal ladies to observe street festivities without being seen.
	Jantar Mantar – An astronomical observatory built by Maharaja Jai Singh II, featuring large instruments to measure time, predict eclipses, and track celestial bodies.
	Jal Mahal – The “Water Palace” is a beautiful structure sitting in the middle of Man Sagar Lake, admired for its unique location and picturesque surroundings.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival, City Palace, and Jantar Mantar
Day 2: Amber Fort and Jal Mahal
Day 3: Hawa Mahal and shopping in local markets
Day 4: Nahargarh Fort and departure

title: Leh-Ladakh
description: A cold desert known for its dramatic mountain landscapes, Buddhist monasteries, and thrilling adventure routes.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and acclimatization in Leh
Day 2: Local sightseeing – Shanti Stupa, Leh Palace
Day 3: Nubra Valley via Khardung La Pass
Day 4: Pangong Lake excursion
Day 5: Visit monasteries – Hemis and Thiksey
Day 6: Departure

title: Kerala
description:
Leh Palace is a majestic 17th-century nine-story royal residence overlooking Leh town, showcasing Tibetan architecture and offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains.

Shanti Stupa is a white-domed Buddhist monument built for world peace, located on a hilltop near Leh, famous for stunning sunrise and sunset views.

Nubra Valley is a scenic high-altitude valley known for its sand dunes, double-humped Bactrian camels, and vibrant Buddhist culture.

Pangong Lake is a breathtaking saltwater lake famous for its changing colors and serene beauty, stretching between India and China.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival in Kochi, local sightseeing
Day 2: Alleppey backwaters and houseboat stay
Day 3: Munnar tea gardens
Day 4: Thekkady and Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary
Day 5: Departure

title: Agra
description: Taj Mahal, Agra Fort, and Fatehpur Sikri are iconic monuments that reflect the grandeur of the Mughal era in Agra. The Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a white marble mausoleum built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, symbolizing eternal love. The Agra Fort, another UNESCO site, is a massive red sandstone fortress that served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors. Fatehpur Sikri, a beautifully preserved ghost city, was built by Akbar as his capital and abandoned due to water scarcity. Together, they showcase Agra’s architectural brilliance and historical importance.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Taj Mahal and Agra Fort
Day 2: Fatehpur Sikri and departure

title: Rishikesh
description:
Triveni Ghat is a sacred confluence of three holy rivers—Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati—where devotees gather for ritual baths and evening Ganga Aarti ceremonies, creating a deeply spiritual atmosphere.

Laxman Jhula is an iconic iron suspension bridge across the Ganges, believed to be the path crossed by Lord Rama’s brother, Laxman. It offers stunning views of the river and surrounding hills.

Ram Jhula is another famous suspension bridge near Laxman Jhula, linking the banks of the Ganges and connecting important temples and ashrams, bustling with pilgrims and tourists.

Neelkanth Mahadev Temple, nestled in the hills near Rishikesh, is dedicated to Lord Shiva and attracts devotees especially during Maha Shivratri for its serene setting and religious significance.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Ganga Aarti
Day 2: Yoga sessions and local temples
Day 3: River rafting and departure

title: Varanasi
description:
Dashashwamedh Ghat is one of the oldest and most vibrant ghats on the banks of the Ganges in Varanasi. It is famous for its spectacular evening Ganga Aarti, where priests perform elaborate rituals with fire, lamps, and chants, attracting thousands of devotees and tourists.

Sarnath is a sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site located just outside Varanasi. It is where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon after attaining enlightenment, making it a place of great historical and spiritual significance with ancient stupas, monasteries, and museums.

Assi Ghat is a peaceful and popular ghat at the southern end of Varanasi. It is known for its lively morning yoga sessions, vibrant cultural activities, and as a favored spot for locals and visitors to relax by the river.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and evening Ganga Aarti
Day 2: Boat ride on Ganges and visit Sarnath
Day 3: Local market and departure

title: Udaipur
description:
City Palace is a grand palace complex overlooking Lake Pichola, showcasing exquisite Rajasthani and Mughal architecture with sprawling courtyards, ornate balconies, and museums displaying royal artifacts.

Lake Pichola is a picturesque artificial freshwater lake famous for its scenic boat rides, offering stunning views of the city’s palaces, temples, and ghats.

Jag Mandir is a charming island palace on Lake Pichola, known for its elegant gardens, marble structures, and historical significance as a royal retreat.

Saheliyon Ki Bari is a delightful garden adorned with fountains, lotus pools, and marble pavilions, created for the royal ladies as a place of leisure and beauty.
plan_per_day: Day 1: City Palace and Lake Pichola
Day 2: Jag Mandir and Saheliyon Ki Bari
Day 3: Local markets and departure

title: Mysore
description:
Mysore Palace is a magnificent royal residence and one of India’s grandest palaces, known for its stunning Indo-Saracenic architecture, intricate carvings, vibrant murals, and dazzling illumination during festivals.

Chamundi Hills rise majestically above Mysore and are home to the revered Chamundeshwari Temple, dedicated to the goddess Durga. The hills offer panoramic views of the city and attract pilgrims and tourists alike.

St. Philomena’s Cathedral is a beautiful Gothic-style church built with impressive stained glass windows and towering spires, making it one of the largest churches in India and a serene place of worship.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Mysore Palace and local sightseeing
Day 2: Chamundi Hills and St. Philomena's Cathedral
Day 3: Local markets and departure

title: Paris
description:
Eiffel Tower is the symbol of Paris and one of the most recognizable structures in the world. This iron lattice tower offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city from its multiple observation decks.

Louvre Museum is the world’s largest art museum, home to thousands of masterpieces including the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo, showcasing art and artifacts from ancient civilizations to modern times.

Notre-Dame Cathedral is a stunning example of French Gothic architecture, famous for its intricate façade, soaring towers, and beautiful stained glass windows.

Montmartre is a historic hilltop neighborhood known for its artistic heritage, charming streets, the Sacré-Cœur Basilica, and vibrant café culture.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Eiffel Tower visit
Day 2: Louvre Museum and Notre-Dame
Day 3: Montmartre and Sacré-Cœur
Day 4: Palace of Versailles day trip
Day 5: Shopping and departure

title: Rome
description:
Colosseum is an iconic ancient amphitheater known for gladiatorial contests and grand public spectacles. It stands as a symbol of Rome’s imperial power and architectural ingenuity.

Roman Forum was the political, religious, and commercial heart of ancient Rome, filled with ruins of temples, basilicas, and public spaces that reveal the city’s glorious past.

Vatican Museums house an extraordinary collection of art and historical artifacts, including the Sistine Chapel ceiling painted by Michelangelo, attracting millions of visitors annually.

St. Peter’s Basilica is a masterpiece of Renaissance architecture and the largest church in the world, serving as the spiritual center of the Catholic Church and a pilgrimage site.

Trevi Fountain is a magnificent Baroque fountain where visitors toss coins over their shoulders to ensure a return to Rome, admired for its dramatic sculptures and flowing waters.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Colosseum
Day 2: Roman Forum and Palatine Hill
Day 3: Vatican Museums and St. Peter's Basilica
Day 4: Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps
Day 5: Departure

title: New York
description:
Times Square is the vibrant heart of Manhattan, famous for its dazzling digital billboards, bustling crowds, and being the epicenter of New Year’s Eve celebrations.

Statue of Liberty stands as a powerful symbol of freedom and democracy, welcoming visitors and immigrants arriving by sea since 1886.

Central Park is a sprawling urban oasis offering lush greenery, walking trails, lakes, and recreational spaces amid the city’s skyscrapers.

Broadway is the world-renowned theater district, home to spectacular plays and musicals that draw audiences from across the globe.

Brooklyn Bridge is a historic suspension bridge connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn, admired for its stunning architecture and scenic views of the city skyline
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Times Square
Day 2: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island
Day 3: Central Park and Museum of Modern Art
Day 4: Broadway show and 5th Avenue shopping
Day 5: Brooklyn Bridge and Chinatown
Day 6: Departure

title: Tokyo
description:
Shibuya is a bustling district in Tokyo famous for the iconic Shibuya Crossing, vibrant shopping, nightlife, and youth culture, making it one of the city’s liveliest spots.

Meiji Shrine is a serene Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken, surrounded by a peaceful forested area offering a spiritual retreat in the heart of Tokyo.

Tokyo Tower is a striking red-and-white communications and observation tower inspired by the Eiffel Tower, providing panoramic views of Tokyo’s sprawling skyline.

Senso-ji Temple is Tokyo’s oldest Buddhist temple, renowned for its impressive Kaminarimon gate, bustling Nakamise shopping street, and rich cultural heritage.

Mount Fuji is Japan’s highest and most famous mountain, revered as a sacred symbol of beauty and endurance, attracting climbers and photographers worldwide.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Shibuya Crossing
Day 2: Meiji Shrine and Harajuku
Day 3: Tokyo Tower and Roppongi Hills
Day 4: Asakusa and Senso-ji Temple
Day 5: Day trip to Mount Fuji
Day 6: Shopping and departure

title: Sydney
description:
Sydney Opera House is an architectural masterpiece and one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world, known for its sail-like design and vibrant performances in music, theater, and dance.

Harbour Bridge, affectionately called the “Coathanger,” is a steel arch bridge connecting Sydney’s central business district with the North Shore. It offers panoramic views and an adventurous BridgeClimb experience.

Bondi Beach is a world-famous beach known for its golden sands, excellent surfing conditions, and laid-back coastal vibe, making it a favorite among locals and tourists alike.

Blue Mountains is a stunning natural wonder near Sydney, featuring dramatic cliffs, eucalyptus forests, waterfalls, and the iconic Three Sisters rock formation, ideal for hiking and scenic lookouts.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Circular Quay
Day 2: Sydney Opera House and Royal Botanic Gardens
Day 3: Bondi Beach and coastal walk
Day 4: Blue Mountains day trip
Day 5: Departure

title: London
description:
Tower of London is a historic fortress on the River Thames, known for its rich history as a royal palace, prison, and home to the Crown Jewels.

Buckingham Palace is the official residence of the British monarch, famous for its grand architecture, royal ceremonies, and the Changing of the Guard.

Westminster Abbey is a magnificent Gothic church and UNESCO World Heritage Site, where British monarchs are crowned and many notable figures are buried.

London Eye is a giant observation wheel on the South Bank, offering breathtaking panoramic views of London’s skyline and landmarks.

Windsor Castle is the world’s oldest and largest inhabited castle, serving as a royal residence and hosting centuries of British royal history and architecture.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Tower of London
Day 2: Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey
Day 3: British Museum and Covent Garden
Day 4: London Eye and Southbank
Day 5: Day trip to Windsor Castle
Day 6: Departure

title: Dubai
description:
Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world, soaring to a height of 828 meters. It offers breathtaking views from its observation decks, stunning architecture, and a symbol of modern Dubai’s ambition and innovation.

Dubai Mall is one of the world’s largest shopping and entertainment destinations, featuring over 1,200 stores, an indoor aquarium, ice rink, VR park, and a wide variety of dining and leisure options.

Desert Safari is a thrilling adventure into Dubai’s vast desert landscapes, offering dune bashing, camel rides, sandboarding, and traditional Bedouin-style camps with cultural performances and Arabian cuisine.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Dubai Mall
Day 2: Burj Khalifa and Fountain show
Day 3: Desert safari
Day 4: Departure

title: Bangkok
description:
Grand Palace in Bangkok is a dazzling complex of royal buildings that once served as the residence of Thai kings. It showcases traditional Thai architecture with golden spires, intricate carvings, and the revered Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Phra Kaew).

Wat Pho is home to the magnificent Reclining Buddha statue and is considered the birthplace of traditional Thai massage. The temple complex is rich with murals, stupas, and serene courtyards.

Floating Market offers a vibrant cultural experience where vendors sell fresh produce, local snacks, and handicrafts from wooden boats, giving visitors a glimpse into traditional Thai river life.

Ayutthaya is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and former capital of the Kingdom of Siam. It features ancient temple ruins, majestic Buddha statues, and historic architecture that reflect Thailand’s glorious past.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Grand Palace
Day 2: Wat Pho and floating market
Day 3: Chatuchak Market and Chinatown
Day 4: Day trip to Ayutthaya
Day 5: Departure

title: Singapore
description:
Marina Bay Sands is an architectural marvel and luxury resort known for its unique boat-shaped SkyPark, offering stunning views of the Singapore skyline, a rooftop infinity pool, a casino, and world-class shopping and dining.

Gardens by the Bay is a futuristic nature park featuring the stunning Supertree Grove, Cloud Forest, and Flower Dome. It combines horticulture with cutting-edge design, creating an urban oasis that showcases biodiversity and sustainability.

Merlion Park is home to Singapore’s iconic half-lion, half-fish statue, symbolizing the city’s humble origins as a fishing village and its modern growth. It’s a popular photo spot overlooking Marina Bay.

Sentosa Island is a resort getaway offering beautiful beaches, adventure parks, luxury hotels, and attractions like Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, and more, making it a top family destination.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Marina Bay Sands
Day 2: Gardens by the Bay and Merlion Park
Day 3: Sentosa Island and Universal Studios
Day 4: Departure

title: Cape Town
description:
able Mountain is a flat-topped mountain offering breathtaking views of Cape Town and the Atlantic Ocean. Accessible by cable car or hiking, it’s a natural wonder and symbol of the city’s beauty.

V&A Waterfront is a bustling harbor-side destination filled with shops, restaurants, museums, and entertainment. It blends modern attractions with historic charm and offers beautiful views of the ocean and Table Mountain.

Robben Island is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and former prison where Nelson Mandela was held for 18 years. Today, it serves as a powerful symbol of South Africa’s struggle for freedom and equality.

Cape Winelands is a picturesque region known for its rolling vineyards, historic wine estates, and charming towns like Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. It’s perfect for wine tasting, gourmet dining, and scenic countryside experiences.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and V&A Waterfront
Day 2: Table Mountain and city tour
Day 3: Cape Winelands
Day 4: Robben Island
Day 5: Beaches and nature reserves
Day 6: Departure

title: Istanbul
description:
Hagia Sophia is a magnificent architectural wonder that has served as a cathedral, mosque, and now a mosque-museum. Famous for its massive dome, mosaics, and rich history, it reflects the city’s Byzantine and Ottoman heritage.

Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmed Mosque) is renowned for its stunning blue İznik tiles, six elegant minarets, and grand courtyard. It remains an active place of worship and a prime example of classical Ottoman architecture.

Topkapi Palace was the opulent residence of Ottoman sultans for centuries. The palace complex includes lavish courtyards, imperial chambers, and sacred relics, offering a glimpse into royal life.

Grand Bazaar is one of the world’s oldest and largest covered markets, bustling with thousands of shops selling carpets, spices, jewelry, ceramics, and more, creating a vibrant shopping experience.

Bosphorus is the strait that separates Europe and Asia, offering scenic cruises past historic palaces, mosques, and waterfront neighborhoods, capturing the essence of Istanbul’s unique geographic and cultural charm.
plan_per_day: Day 1: Arrival and Sultanahmet area
Day 2: Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque
Day 3: Bosphorus cruise and Grand Bazaar
Day 4: Topkapi Palace and Spice Market
Day 5: Departure
